official-title.#text:
To repeal the provisions of the Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2015, which
			 amended the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to establish separate
			 contribution limits for contributions made to national parties to support
			 Presidential nominating conventions, national party headquarters
			 buildings, and recounts.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text:
Repeal of separate contribution limits for certain contributions made to national committees of
			 political parties

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is repealed, and
			 any provision of law amended by such section shall be restored as if such
			 section had not been enacted into law.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 101 of the Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2015
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2015/s:101

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2015
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2015

text.#text: The amendment made by subsection (a) shall take effect as if included in the enactment of the

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 5887 IH: To repeal the provisions of the Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2015, which amended the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 to establish separate contribution limits for contributions made to national parties to support Presidential nominating conventions, national party headquarters buildings, and recounts.
